alert.note: Alert for Coastal Onslow; East Carteret; Hatteras Island; Mainland Dare; Mainland Hyde; Northern Outer Banks; Ocracoke Island; West Carteret (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 26 at 6:15AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG CONTINUES TO IMPACT COASTAL COMMUNITIES THIS MORNING... Sea fog continues to impact the entire length of the Eastern North Carolina coastline at this time, with impacts expected to last through at least mid-morning. Dense fog has not yet become widespread, but is still leading to impacts due to sudden reductions in visibility. This will especially be impactful for drivers during the morning commute. Travel along coastal roads such as NC 210 on Topsail Island, NC 58 on Bogue Banks, NC 12 through the Outer Banks, and NC 264 along the western Pamlico Sound, will be the roadways most impacted. Motorists should be prepared for abrupt visibility reductions, reduce speeds and use low beam headlights.
